docs.snippet: A photograph posted on Twitter of Steve Smith's autobiography "The Journey" in the 'True Crime' section of a Brisbane bookstore cruelly sums up the spectacular self-destruction of one of modern cricket's most illustrious careers.

headline.print_headline: Smith's Legacy Undone by Improper Sticky Tape
headline.main: Smith's Legacy Undone by Improper Sticky Tape

docs.snippet: SoftBank Group Corp. Chief Executive Masayoshi Son announced Wednesday a $200 billion solar power project in Saudi Arabia, which he described as "the world's biggest solar power generation."

headline.print_headline: SoftBank, Saudi Arabia Announce Massive Solar Power Project
headline.main: SoftBank, Saudi Arabia Announce Massive Solar Power Project

docs.snippet: Our Tech We’re Using columnist, Brian Chen, is eager to hear feedback from readers and requests for future columns about how Times journalists use tech.

headline.print_headline: What Topics Should the ‘Tech We’re Using’ Column Tackle Next?
headline.main: What Topics Should the ‘Tech We’re Using’ Column Tackle Next?

docs.snippet: More than 25 million people, a number greater than Australia's population, have applied for about 90,000 positions on India's state-run railways, underlining the challenge Prime Minister Narendra Modi faces in providing millions of jobs ahead of a...

headline.print_headline: More Than 25 Million People Apply for Indian Railway Vacancies
headline.main: More Than 25 Million People Apply for Indian Railway Vacancies

docs.snippet: GlaxoSmithKline is buying Novartis out of their consumer healthcare joint venture for $13 billion, taking full control of products including Sensodyne toothpaste, Panadol headache tablets, muscle gel Voltaren, and Nicotinell patches.

headline.print_headline: GSK Buys Out Novartis in $13 Billion Consumer Healthcare Shake-Up
headline.main: GSK Buys Out Novartis in $13 Billion Consumer Healthcare Shake-Up

docs.snippet: British Airways said it will retain its in-house call centres in Newcastle and Manchester, dashing Capita's hopes of winning contracts to run the operations.

headline.print_headline: BA Opts to Keep Two Call Centres In-House, Dashes Capita's Hopes
headline.main: BA Opts to Keep Two Call Centres In-House, Dashes Capita's Hopes

docs.snippet: He is crisscrossing Pakistan championing a fatwa, or Islamic religious decree, forbidding militant violence inside the country. But the mere fact that Fazlur Rehman Khalil, veteran leader of an organization designated as a terror group by the U.S....

headline.print_headline: Militant Leader, Ex-Bin Laden Ally Roams Freely in Pakistan
headline.main: Militant Leader, Ex-Bin Laden Ally Roams Freely in Pakistan

docs.snippet: The Philippines will be one of three teams making their debut at the expanded Asian Cup in 2019 after sealing their spot with Tuesday's 2-1 win over Tajikistan, and skipper Phil Younghusband hopes qualification will spark a new era of soccer growt...

headline.print_headline: Philippines, Yemen Secure Maiden Spots at Expanded Asian Cup
headline.main: Philippines, Yemen Secure Maiden Spots at Expanded Asian Cup

docs.snippet: The European Union began a study on Monday on whether the import tariffs imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump warranted action to prevent predominantly Asian producers flooding Europe with steel.

headline.print_headline: EU Starts Study Into Possible Steel Import Limits
headline.main: EU Starts Study Into Possible Steel Import Limits

docs.snippet: The United States has agreed to double its planned 2018 budget contribution to the ITER project to build a prototype nuclear fusion reactor, avoiding delays to the international project this year, its director said on Monday.

headline.print_headline: ITER Nuclear Fusion Project Avoids Delays as U.S. Doubles Budget
headline.main: ITER Nuclear Fusion Project Avoids Delays as U.S. Doubles Budget
